repnme.cdata!:
Cote d'Ivoire - Agricultural Sector
            Adjustment Loan Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Agricultural Sector
            Adjustment Loan Project for Cote d'Ivoire was
            satisfactory. The project achieved most of its objectives,
            institutional development was modest, sustainability is
            uncertain, and the performance of both the Bank and Borrower
            was satisfactory. Several lessons can be learned from this
            project. First, in some areas, the vagueness of
            conditionality worked against program success, while in
            others it "bought time" until the political
            situation changed sufficiently so that successful policy
            dialogue could occur. Second, the presence of strong field
            staff at the Resident Mission was critical to the initiation
            of a constructive dialogue process. Third, the developmental
            impacts of policy change should be monitored more closely in
            the future. Finally, broad participation of all parties
            concerned is necessary for policy reform programs to succeed
            in the first place and be sustainable in the long run.

repnme.cdata!:
Cote d'Ivoire - Agricultural Sector
            Adjustment Loan

abstracts.cdata!:
The main objective of the agricultural
            adjustment program is to achieve in the medium term in the
            sector a sustained rate of growth of about 4 % per annum
            while reducing urban-rural and regional income disparities.
            Measures will be taken to : 1) improve the domestic terms of
            trade in favor of agriculture, 2) shift incentives in favor
            of crops with high comparative advantage away from crops
            that have declining economic benefits such as cocoa, 3)
            decrease costs in the agro-industrial sector to restore its
            competitiveness on domestic and external markets, 4) reduce
            public sector involvement in directly productive activities
            and increase the efficiency of parastatals providing basis
            support services to farmers, 5) improve rural financial
            intermediation and farmers' access to savings and
            credit facilities, and 6) improve the management of the
            country's natural resources, in particular by promoting
            the protection and sustainable exploitation of natural forests.
